result.execSummary:
The defendant Dimitrius D Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Probation may be transferred to the State of Georgia.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with co-defendants or victims listed in the criminal complaint. NOT to possess any checks or checking account (unless his paycheck made out to him). Provide Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Not to leave the State of Georgia unless authorized by agent.  Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time, commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 142 days were granted.

records.addlTxt: copy of Special Agent Williams statement from August 7, 2015 court date for Desmond Harris (Case #15CF539
filed by the state
pretrial incarceration credit sheet

Defendant Dimitrius D Roberts in court, in custody, with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations. Attorney Harris makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

5 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT 
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS   **Transfer allowed to State of Georgia**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendant's or victims listed in criminal complaint
____Not to use or possess any checks or checking account (unless paycheck made out to him)
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Not to leave State of Georgia unless authorized by agent

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

CONDITION TIME:  180 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME (credit for 142 days), commencing forthwith (Defendant already in custody)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Dimitrius D Roberts in court, in custody, with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2-8 are dismissed and read-in.  State requests a presentence investigation.  Attorney Harris does not request a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing date.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dimitrius D Roberts in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ass't Chief Jason Hennen from the Village of Elm Grove was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and moves to dismiss. Court denied. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments. State objects to any bail modification. Court denied the motion.  Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
